headline.main: Schmitt, Ex-Astronaut, to Face Montoya in Contest for Senate

results.snippet: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., June 1 Harrison Schmitt, the former astronaut who walked on the moon, won the Republican nomination tonight to oppose Senator Joseph ,M. Montoya,, Democrat, in his bid for a third six-year term.
results.lead_paragraph: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., June 1 Harrison Schmitt, the former astronaut who walked on the moon, won the Republican nomination tonight to oppose Senator Joseph ,M. Montoya,, Democrat, in his bid for a third six-year term.

results.abstract: Montoya defeats Sims in Dem primary by 2-to-1 margin (S)
results.snippet: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., June 2 (AP) Senator Joseph M. Montoya won yesterday the Democratic nomination for a third six-year term by a 2-to-1 margin over Robert R. Sims. In November, he will face Harrison Schmitt, a former astronaut who easily won the...
results.lead_paragraph: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., June 2 (AP) Senator Joseph M. Montoya won yesterday the Democratic nomination for a third six-year term by a 2-to-1 margin over Robert R. Sims. In November, he will face Harrison Schmitt, a former astronaut who easily won the Republican Senate primary.

headline.main: Ohio: Urban and Industrial Yet Republican

results.snippet: CINCINNATI In "The Megastates of America," Neal R. Peirce begins his discussion of the nation's sixth-largest state with these words: "Ohio, mother of second-rate Presidents, hung up about its own identity (East to Westerners, West to Easterners),...
results.lead_paragraph: CINCINNATI In "The Megastates of America," Neal R. Peirce begins his discussion of the nation's sixth-largest state with these words: "Ohio, mother of second-rate Presidents, hung up about its own identity (East to Westerners, West to Easterners), the personification of the middle-class society, is the least distinctive of the great industrial states."

headline.main: MUSIC VIEW; A Squint Into the Summery Haze Of Future Festivals

results.snippet: All future music critics come equipped at birth with the gift of omniscience, which is a help in later life. But an almost equally valuable attribute, omnipresence, is denied them by an all-wise nature, and that can make planning summers something of...
results.lead_paragraph: All future music critics come equipped at birth with the gift of omniscience, which is a help in later life. But an almost equally valuable attribute, omnipresence, is denied them by an all-wise nature, and that can make planning summers something of a problem.

results.snippet: RIPE PICKINGS With little fanfare, a singing guitaristcowboy from North Carolina named Harry Robbins arrived in a midtown showcase. The guitarist has two musical backers, Vin Leary on the bass-guitar and "Sailor Bob" Smith on the harmonica, both...
results.lead_paragraph: RIPE PICKINGS With little fanfare, a singing guitaristcowboy from North Carolina named Harry Robbins arrived in a midtown showcase. The guitarist has two musical backers, Vin Leary on the bass-guitar and "Sailor Bob" Smith on the harmonica, both seasoned New Yorkers. Among them, with Mr. Robbins to the fore, they make country sounds as soothing and right as rain on an apple barrel.

results.abstract: Former US Sen Howard Metzenbaum wins Dem Sen primary, obtaining 53% of vote in race against Repr James Stanton and 2 lesser-known opponents; Metzenbaum's pol career traced; Metzenbaum will oppose incumbent Repub Sen Robert Taft Jr, who was unopposed, in Nov; US Repr Wayne L Hays (Dem) wins renomination to 15th term despite implication in Elizabeth Ray payroll-and-sex controversy but winning margin over perennial challenger Nick Karnick is by less than 3-to-2; will face ind candidate Steubenville Mayor William Crabbe in fall; in contest to fill Stanton's HR seat in 20th Cong Dist, Cleveland City Councilwoman Mary Rose Oakar tops field of 11 candidates in Dem primary (M)

headline.main: Democrats Choose Metzenbaum To Oppose Taft for Senate Seat

results.snippet: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 9 While the Ford and Carter Presidential tides rolled across Ohio yesterday, Democratic voters propelled former United States Senator Howard Metzenbaum into a November race against Robert Taft Jr. Mr. Taft, the state's incumbent...

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. STEVENS Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 9 While the Ford and Carter Presidential tides rolled across Ohio yesterday, Democratic voters propelled former United States Senator Howard Metzenbaum into a November race against Robert Taft Jr. Mr. Taft, the state's incumbent Republican Senator, was unopposed in the primary.

results.abstract: Writer Judith Wax describes experimental job-finding program set up in Carbondale (Ill) by behavioral psychologist Dr Nathan Azrin; program is supported by Ill Mental Health Dept and Natl Inst of Mental Health grants; club atmosphere of program is aimed at keeping jobless workers actively pursuing job opportunities; illustrations (L)

headline.main: Mission Employable; An Illinois job-finding club teaches its members that joblessness is a state of mind. Job finding

results.snippet: In an election year, the Ford Administration is under pressure to show it's doing something about unemployment. And recently the Department of Labor gave preliminary approval for job-finding programs like the experimental one originated by a...
results.lead_paragraph: In an election year, the Ford Administration is under pressure to show it's doing something about unemployment. And recently the Department of Labor gave preliminary approval for job-finding programs like the experimental one originated by a behavioral psychologist in Carbondale, Ill., to be set up on a pilot basis in from three to five other U.S. cities.

results.abstract: Rev of speculation on Pres running mates notes that Vice Pres has become surest route to Pres; finds that despite urgings for reform, there appears little change in traditional methods of choosing running mates; cartoon (M)

headline.main: Styles in Running Mates Are Not Likely to Change

results.snippet: WASHINGTON--Jimmy Carter breezed through the Capital the other day and said he was whittling his list of Democratic running mates. The gossip at the Republican National Committee meeting here this weekend turned on whether Ronald Reagan might settle...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON--Jimmy Carter breezed through the Capital the other day and said he was whittling his list of Democratic running mates. The gossip at the Republican National Committee meeting here this weekend turned on whether Ronald Reagan might settle for the second spot on the party ticket. Suddenly, inevitably, the politicians were all wrapped up in the quadrennial game of picking running mates.
